topics.body:
"@hype":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b0c1cd6368726c7b0019fb#post_55b0c1cd6368726c7b0019fb
[bq="hype"]fuckitfuckitfuckit it's going to take all of my will but i'm sleeping now[/bq]From my experience, actually _trying_ to go to sleep makes it literally impossible to go to sleep. Because then my mind is consciously focused on it, and I can't fall asleep while I'm doing that.
I'll sometimes lie awake in bed for hours at a time for this exact reason.
topics.author: 53f29d1b6368725f76ba0100

"@SuperSupermario24":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b11a296368725a8f001ace#post_55b11a296368725a8f001ace

topics.body:
"@Carcass Strife":/dis/the-time-wasting-thread/post/55b11b666368721819001167#post_55b11b666368721819001167
I usually seem to only be able to go to sleep when I stop _actively_ trying to.
Of course, it's impossible to pin down when I do, or what I'm thinking about when I do, but consciously thinking about trying to go to sleep makes it impossible to fall unconscious to me.
topics.author: 53f29d1b6368725f76ba0100
